Manuscript:
An example set of data read in from ManuscriptLoader.cs</!-->
Not much point in going back there.
BeanStreet</!-->
Oú est le piscine chaud? J’oublie, mais je pense que c’est loin de ici. Where is the hot water pool? It's around here, but I forgot where.
Where is the... I can't even tell what that is, but apparently he forgot it. And it’s around here somewhere...
I didn't understand any of that!
Oú est la salle des poubelles? Je ne sais pas. Need text
A bucket room? Man, this culture sure is different.
J’aime le café ici, mais les serveurs ne veille pas parler a moi. Need text
Well this little guy likes something here, but someone doesn’t want to talk to him? Oh, the service, guess we’re not so different after all... The service industry leave something to be desired everywhere I guess.
Wow, there's a lot of stuff in this box! Aw, it's all junk.
Aw man, there's my favorite action figures in here! Oh wait, they’re all busted. Probably because they're second hand from the surface.
There are many smashed ceramic mugs on the surface. I don’t really want to dig around any more...
Secret Area 1</!-->
There’s a pool with bubbling water... looks hot
Apparently something is very something...
This pool is a total hottie
L’eau est trés chaud! Need Text
Hmm...
Secret Area 2</!-->
There are many empty drink cans. Huh, there’s no deposit on them. ... How’d they manage collect all these cans without a cash incentive??
Hold on, that sign said this box was only for certain cans... ... Oh! It's for cans after you drink their fizzy contents!
Big box of empty cans
This box is full of trash, but no cans.
Requires boisson gazeuse: soft drink/fizzy drink in order to get a success</!-->
Boîte est pour les boisson gazeuse boîte que vous buvez Need Text
Hmm... there's a apparently a box for fizzy drinks that have been... ... something.
Oh, right! The box with all the empty cans! It's for cans after you drink their fizzy contents!
I don't think I have enough words to figure out what the heck this says...
...
Cafe</!-->
Boissons: Café, Boissons Gaseuse, Lait... There's a picture next to each item on this menu! Let's see here...
More menus should have pictures on them, I think.
The servers are just running around... They seem pretty busy.
NPCs</!-->
Je besoin une café, mais les serveurs sont occupé. Test here
I think they are busy daydreaming...
These guys look like they’re having a staring contest. I don’t want to interrupt.
The stove burners are all on, with nothing on them.
Froid seulement! Cold Only!
The left faucet doesn’t seem to work... The right one, on the other hand is giving some pretty chilly water!
I sure hope these guys have access to a plumber.
House</!-->
There are a bunch of puppets behind it! But where is the puppet master?
No drinking on the job! ... Also I’m not of the Sleep Knight legal age yet, 10,000 winks.
There’s an assortment of decorative feathers here.
There is a small fridge looking thing. Wait... I think it’s connected to the café! They’re supplying him with drinks!
DrinkBird DB - Drinkbird DBC - Drinkbird command
</!-->
J’aime boire le café toujours I love drinking hot coffee
This bird seems awfully jittery... What the heck is he doing?
No wonder he's so jittery, he keeps drinking coffee! Maybe I could tell him to drink a sleep-friendly alternative?
I don't think I have any words I can use on him yet
... I don't think he understood me
He looks at me inquisitively
... Utiliser que?
He took some milk out of the fridge and poured it on the floor. He looks pretty pleased with himself.
He shook it up and sprayed it all over himself! Now he’s all sticky...
... ...he continues to drink the coffee
He starts munching on a teabag. Gross!
I think I'm going to need a more specific verb than use...
Commands for drinkin
</!-->
He goes to get some fresh coffee...
I think he might be getting even more jittery!
He goes to get a fizzy drink from the fridge...
Buuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuurp
I guess some things go across all language barriers... Even Cave speak.
He pours out some milk from the carton.
J’aime le lait froid!
He still looks pretty awake.
He grabs a cup of tea
... Suddenly, he rushed out of the room! He came back a minute later, looking relieved
He grabs a chilled coffee from the fridge.
I suppose a true coffee lover enjoys coffees of all temperatures.
He sticks his tounge out at me and goes “bleeehhh”. I don't think I have a word for that in my book.
He hops over to the fridge and pulls a steaming cup of milk out of it. (How’d he manage that???)
... ... ..............................................
...
